bibl.title: Letter from John D. Long to Henry Rose Carter, November 6, 1922

div1.p: Long sends Carter copies of correspondence about a possible yellow fever case at Mobile, Alabama.

div1.head: Letter from John D. Long to Henry Rose Carter, November 6, 1922
div1.opener:
N. H. B.
Wickliffe Rose's tell
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
IN REPLYING
ADDRESS THE SURGEON GENERAL
U. S. PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
BUREAU OF
THE PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
WASHINGTON
November 6, 1922.
Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
United States Public Health Service,
2121 California Street, N.W.,
Washington, D. C.
Dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
In response to your letter dated November 4, 1922,
I am inclosing herewith for your information file of corres-
pondence enc. 1; enc. 2; enc. 3; enc. 4 relative to the case of yellow fever on the American
Schooner “William E. Burnham,” which arrived at the port of
Mobile, Alabama.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, J. D. Long,
Assistant Surgeon-General. JDL/LAR
Inclosures.
